TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebResourceAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Defines the metadata attribute that enables an embedded resource in an assembly. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The WebResourceAttribute class is valid only when used on assembly declarations. It is used to enable a specified embedded resource in an assembly for use as a Web resource. For more information on resources, see [ASP.NET Web Page Resources Overview](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). ## Examples This section contains two code examples. The first code example demonstrates how to apply the WebResourceAttribute attribute to a namespace that defines a custom control, `MyCustomControl`. The second code example demonstrates how to use the `MyCustomControl` class in a Web page. The following code example demonstrates how to apply the WebResourceAttribute attribute on a custom assembly to define an image Web resource and an HTML Web resource. The `MyCustomControl` class defines a composite control that uses the resources to set the value of the property of an control that is contained within the composite control and to set the property of an control linking to the HTML resource. [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webresou_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webresou_1.vb)] The following code example demonstrates how to use the `MyCustomControl` class in a Web page. [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webresou_2.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webresou_2.aspx)] This example requires that you compile the Image1.jpg and Help.htm resources with the assembly that contains `MyCustomControl`. For more information, see, [/resource (C# Compiler Options)](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) or [/resource (Visual Basic)](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md). An example of an HTML Web resource that could be used in this example is shown next. Note the use of the `WebResource` syntax, which is used when you set the property to `true` for a Web resource. `` `` `` `Included Help Page` `` `` `
` ` />` `Included help file.` `
` `` ``

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string webResource, string contentType) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the of Web resource.
The type of resource, such as `"image/gif"` or `"text/javascript"`.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified Web resource and resource content type.
Docs.exception:
is or an empty string ("").

is or an empty string ("").

Docs.summary: Gets or set the path of a Content Delivery Network (CDN) that contains Web resources.
Docs.value: The path of a Content Delivery Network (CDN).

Docs.summary: Gets or set a value that indicates to the whether a script resource should be accessed using a secure connection to the content delivery network (CDN) path when the page is accessed using HTTPS.
Docs.value: if the CDN should be accessed using HTTPS; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the CdnSupportsSecureConnection property to check whether the associated script resource should be accessed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.ScriptManager> using a secure connection (using SSL) to a CDN. By using the CdnSupportsSecureConnection property, you can avoid a warning message from the browser when your Web application attempts to request secure content from a CDN that supports SSL.

Docs.summary: Gets a string containing the MIME type of the resource that is referenced by the class.
Docs.value: The content type of the resource.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Examples of content types are `"image/jpeg"` and `"text/xml"`. For more information on MIME types, go to the [Internet Assigned Numbers Authority](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=43988) Web site and refer to the section on media types.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to query the value of the ContentType property.
This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute> class.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webresou_0_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webresou_0_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an expression that is used when a Web resource has successfully loaded.
Docs.value: An expression that is used when a Web resource has successfully loaded.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that determines whether, during processing of the embedded resource referenced by the class, other Web resource URLs are parsed and replaced with the full path to the resource.
Docs.value: if embedded resources are resolved during processing of the resource; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks When a resource is streamed from the assembly to the response, references to other Web resources in the embedded resources can be resolved at this time, if the PerformSubstitution property is set to `true`. ## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to query the value of the PerformSubstitution property. In this example, the attribute of the HTML file Help.htm is defined with the PerformSubstitution property set to `true`. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the class. [!code-cs[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webresou_2_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.WebResourceAttribute#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webresou_2_1.aspx)] An example of an HTML Web resource that could be used in this example is shown next. Note that the `WebResource` syntax is used when you set the PerformSubstitution property to `true` for the resource. `` `` `` `Included Help Page` `` `` `
` ` />` `Included help file.` `
` `` ``

Docs.summary: Gets a string containing the name of the resource that is referenced by the class.

remarks.format:
